column4: I have a fresh install of 11.04, the wireless driver won't install. anyone wanna take this one?
getting an error is way too vague; provide tons more details
thanks, here is the error, and log. http://pastebin.com/sZq3G8Tu
what is the chipset, how have you tried to install the drivers, and from where

I'm not 100% on the chipset, how can I tell. I'm trying to use the built in additional driver screen in ubuntu. It sees the driver, and says it knows the driver. This package contains Broadcom 802.11 Linux STA wireless driverfor use with Broadcom's BCM4311-, BCM4312-, BCM4313-, BCM4321-,BCM4322-, BCM43224-, and BCM43225-, BCM43227- and BCM43228-basedhardware.
lspci for the chipset, how were the drivers installed

Network controller: Broadcom Corporation BCM4322 802.11a/b/g/n Wireless LAN Controller (rev 01). The driver is not installed. that's what i am trying to do. When I had Linux Mint installed, i just used the built in proprietary drivers utility, and it just worked. I'm trying to do the same time on Ubuntu, but  it's giving me the error mentioned above.
care to provide a synopsis? was this from additional drivers? did you get it over a wired connection to install?
yes it's from the additional drivers lol, I said that like 6 times... you're helping too many people. fun times! :) I am plugged in via ethernet, that's how I'm on the chat right now.
is that the name of the package I should install?
does this mean I already have it? http://pastebin.com/U9yttPV3
no way to move the unity dock, just use classic and something like cairo-dock or awn
or try unity-2d if that is to resource hungry
